summary: Build a website and mobile app for GreenPlantz, an online store selling garden products and plants, with separate role-based logins for GreenPlantz team admins, Garden Nursery owners/teams, and Customers, including nursery-level management capabilities.
architectural_notes: Introduce RBAC with distinct roles (GreenPlantz admin, nursery owner/team, customer) and permissions for product/nursery management and account disabling/removal.
Add role-based portal entry links in the SiteFooter (Quick Links) routing to /portal/nursery, /portal/team, and /portal/customer.
Update SiteFooter bottom section to include business contact methods (WhatsApp, Instagram, support email) alongside existing quick links; keep role-based portal links intact.
Extend role-based portals to include explicit registration + sign-in UIs for Nursery/Vendor and GreenPlantz Team/Admin.
Nursery product management UI must support attaching/displaying product photos (image upload/selection and rendering on product details).
GreenPlantz Team/Admin UI should include nursery/shop listing with drill-down to products and an action to remove a nursery/shop.
Update SiteFooter contact/business info area to also display GreenPlantz service areas/locations text: "Kerala | Karnataka | Tamil Nadu | Andra Pradesh".

Adopt a hierarchical category taxonomy (e.g., Plants → Indoor/Outdoor; Pots → Ceramic/Plastic/Fiber; plus Seeds and Fertilizers) and ensure nursery product creation/edit flows include category/subcategory selection mapped to backend category IDs.
Ensure SiteHeader logo uses responsive sizing (CSS width/height/max-height/object-fit) so the GreenPlantz logo renders at the required size consistently across devices.

Header logo must reference an existing static asset under frontend/public (e.g., /public/assets/generated) and the build must include that directory/file so /assets/generated/... URLs resolve correctly in production.
known_issues: Admin portal access issue: user reports the Team/Admin portal stays blank / shows Access Denied and the UI does not display the signed-in Internet Identity principal ID anywhere, preventing admin allowlisting.
Branding regression: deployed build does not reflect the updated logo (user reports the logo has not changed after deployment).
Header logo sizing is not correct; needs adjustment to the required dimensions/responsive display.

Broken header logo: SiteHeader references /assets/generated/greenplantz-header-logo.dim_504x112.cb_20260208_01.png but the corresponding /public/assets/generated folder (and file) is missing, causing a broken-image icon in the deployed UI.
Logo issue persists after latest build/deploy attempt (user reports it is still not corrected).
Backend platform-admin allowlist is likely not being updated/persisted on deploy; Principals remain non-admin until grantAdminAccess/addPlatformAdmin is executed against the deployed canister.

existing_features.title: Create a GreenPlantz storefront web app that is fully responsive (mobile-first) and functions as the “website and app” experience (single React app with layouts optimized for desktop, tablet, and phone).

Implement a coherent GreenPlantz visual theme and design system (colors, typography, spacing, buttons, cards) with an earthy garden aesthetic (avoid a blue/purple primary palette) and apply it consistently across all pages.
Implement the core storefront pages: Home, Product Catalog (with category filtering and text search), Product Details, Cart, and Checkout (order review + place order).
Implement cart state management on the frontend (add to cart, update quantity, remove, clear) and persist the cart locally on the client so it survives refreshes.
Implement order placement: on “Place order”, create an order record in the backend and return an order confirmation (order ID + summary).
Add basic customer identity support using Internet Identity so users can view their own order history in the app.
Create an admin-only workflow (protected by a backend-maintained allowlist of admin principals) to manage the product catalog: create product, edit product, and set product active/inactive.
Generate and include required static image assets for the GreenPlantz brand and wire them into the UI via frontend static assets (do not serve generated images from the backend).

Update the frontend to provide distinct role-based entry points (separate portal pages) for: GreenPlantz team, Garden Nursery owners/teams, and Customers. Each portal must require Internet Identity authentication and then route the user to role-appropriate screens based on backend role checks.

Add a nursery dashboard UI for Garden Nursery owners/teams that allows them to view and edit nursery details and manage their own product catalog (create/edit/change and activate/deactivate), using the new backend nursery/product ownership APIs.
Add a GreenPlantz team admin UI section to manage nurseries and nursery team members, including the ability to remove/disable nursery team access when issues arise.

Update the website footer (frontend/src/components/layout/SiteFooter.tsx) “Quick Links” section to include three new internal links: (1) “Vendor or Nursery Registration / Sign In” linking to /portal/nursery, (2) “GreenPlantz Team / Admin Login” linking to /portal/team, and (3) “Customer Login” linking to /portal/customer. Keep the existing footer quick links unless removing them is explicitly required.

Update the website footer contact area to display these contact details with clear labels and clickable links: WhatsApp number +91 6238029664, Instagram handle @greenplantz_, and email caregreenplantz@gmail.com. Use English for all labels.

Add a bottom-of-site social section in the footer that provides prominent social link entry points (WhatsApp, Instagram, Email) placed at the very bottom area of the website footer (below the main footer columns).

Update the Nursery Portal (/portal/nursery) to support a complete Vendor/Nursery onboarding flow using Internet Identity: after the user signs in, if they do not yet belong to a nursery (no gardenCenterMemberships), show a “Sign Up / Register Nursery” form that creates a new nursery (garden center) by calling the backend createGardenCenter(name, location), then routes the user to the Nursery Dashboard upon success.

Update the Nursery Dashboard product creation UI (currently the “Add Product” dialog in frontend/src/pages/nursery/NurseryDashboardPage.tsx) to allow entering multiple product photo URLs (at least 1, up to a reasonable limit such as 5) and previewing them before submission; send these URLs to the backend when creating the product.

Update the Product Details page (frontend/src/pages/ProductDetailsPage.tsx) to display product photos when available (imageUrls non-empty), including a primary image and selectable thumbnails (or a simple gallery) to switch the primary image.
Update storefront product cards (frontend/src/components/store/ProductCard.tsx) to show the first product photo (imageUrls[0]) when available; otherwise keep the existing placeholder behavior.

Enhance the GreenPlantz Team admin nursery management UI (frontend/src/pages/admin/AdminNurseriesPage.tsx) so that, for each nursery shop (garden center), the admin can view the products added by that nursery (using getProductsForGardenCenter) and see key product fields including name, price, stock, active status, and at least one product photo thumbnail when available.

Update the admin nursery management UI to allow a platform admin to remove a nursery shop (garden center) with a confirmation dialog, and refresh the admin list and related product views after the action completes.

Update the website footer to display the GreenPlantz address/service area text "GreenPlantz  Kerala | Karnataka | Tamil Nadu | Andra Pradesh" using English labeling, in a way that is visible on all screen sizes.

Implement a structured product category taxonomy that supports parent/child relationships so the catalog can represent and filter by: Plants → (Indoor Plants, Outdoor Plants), Seeds, Pots → (Ceramic Pots, Plastic Pots, Fiber Pots), and Fertilizers.

Update the storefront catalog filtering UI (frontend/src/pages/CatalogPage.tsx) to support filtering by the new hierarchical categories (parents + subcategories), including the ability to filter specifically by Pots subcategories (Ceramic Pots, Plastic Pots, Fiber Pots).

Update the nursery product creation flow (frontend/src/pages/nursery/NurseryDashboardPage.tsx) so garden nursery team members can assign a category/subcategory from the structured taxonomy when adding a product, and ensure the selected category is sent to the backend as the product’s categoryId.

Update the Team Portal and admin access-denied experiences to display the currently authenticated Internet Identity Principal ID in the UI (English labels), so the Principal can be copied for admin allowlisting.
Add a platform-admin UI screen to manage platform admins by Principal ID (add/remove) and wire it to the new backend allowlist management APIs.
Add the provided GreenPlantz full logo image as a static asset and update the site header to use it as the primary brand logo.
Add the provided GP mark as the site favicon by wiring favicon assets into frontend/index.html.
Ensure the site header uses the newly provided GreenPlantz logo assets so that the visible logo changes on the deployed build (not the old cached/previous logo).

Add the two uploaded images (image-2.png and image-3.png) into frontend static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and update frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx to reference the correct logo file(s) from /assets/generated.

Implement a cache-busting strategy for the header logo so that when the logo asset is updated, clients reliably receive the new version (e.g., by using a new filename and updating the reference in frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx, or by appending a version query parameter to the logo URL).

Add the newly uploaded logo image file "greenplantz final straight logo back ground removed.png" to frontend static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated with a cache-busting filename, and update the Site Header logo (frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx) to use this new asset as its src (replacing the current theme-based logoSrc). Apply this change only to the header logo image element (XPath: /html/body/div/div/header/div/a/img).

Update the site header logo image sizing by modifying ONLY the selected header logo element (XPath: /html/body/div/div/header/div/a/img) in frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx so the GreenPlantz logo displays at an appropriate required size and remains responsive across screen sizes, without overflowing the header height or distorting the logo’s aspect ratio.

Update the Site Header logo image element in frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx to use the newly resized logo asset as its src, replacing the current /assets/generated/greenplantz-final-straight-logo-bg-removed.dim_1536x864.cb_20260208.png reference.

Add the uploaded image (image-4.png) to frontend static assets and generate a header-optimized, transparent PNG logo at exactly 112px height (preserve aspect ratio, no distortion, no extra padding unless needed to avoid clipping), saved under frontend/public/assets/generated using a cache-busting filename.

Update ONLY the SiteHeader logo element in frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx (the inside the home Link) to reference the newly generated cache-busted logo file under /assets/generated/, replacing the currently broken src "/assets/generated/greenplantz-header-logo.dim_504x112.cb_20260208_01.png".

Ensure the SiteHeader logo remains responsive and does not overflow the header height: adjust sizing on ONLY the same SiteHeader logo element if needed so it fits within the header (header container height is h-16) while maintaining the logo’s aspect ratio.

Update ONLY the SiteHeader logo element in frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx (the inside the home Link) to reference the newly generated cache-busted logo file under /assets/generated/, and ensure the referenced file path exists in the built frontend so the logo does not appear broken or replaced by an incorrect/old brand.

Ensure the SiteHeader logo remains responsive and does not overflow the header height (the header container height is h-16) by adjusting sizing classes on ONLY the same SiteHeader logo element if needed, while maintaining the logo’s aspect ratio.

Update ONLY the SiteHeader logo element in frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx (the inside the home Link; current src is "/assets/generated/greenplantz-header-logo.dim_504x112.cb_20260208_03.png") to use the newly generated cache-busted logo asset path under /assets/generated/, and ensure the logo remains responsive and does not overflow the header height (header container height is h-16) while maintaining aspect ratio.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create GreenPlantz ecommerce website for garden products and plants
Create GreenPlantz mobile app for the online store
Add backend product and category data models and query endpoints to support: listing categories, listing products, product search/filtering, and fetching product details by ID.
Provide seed data for GreenPlantz (a reasonable starter set of categories and products spanning plants and garden supplies) so the storefront is populated on first run.
Add role-based authentication/authorization with separate logins for GreenPlantz team (admins), Garden Nursery owners/teams, and Customers.

Add nursery management features: allow authorized nursery owners/teams to manage nursery details and manage (edit/change) their products; allow GreenPlantz team to remove/disable nursery team access when issues arise.

Extend backend authorization to support three distinct application roles: (1) GreenPlantz team (platform admins), (2) Garden Nursery owners/teams (nursery operators), and (3) Customers, all authenticated via Internet Identity principals; expose query methods for the frontend to determine the caller’s role(s).

Add backend data models and APIs for Garden Nurseries, including creating/updating nursery details and managing nursery team membership (add member, remove member, and disable/revoke a member’s access).

Associate products with a nursery in the backend and enforce that nursery owners/teams can only create/edit/change products belonging to their own nursery, while GreenPlantz team admins can manage products across all nurseries.
Add footer quick links for role-based access: Vendor/Nursery Registration or Sign In, GreenPlantz Team/Admin Login, and Customer Login (linking to /portal/nursery, /portal/team, /portal/customer).
Add contact/social details in the website footer (WhatsApp +91 6238029664, Instagram @greenplantz_, email caregreenplantz@gmail.com) and place these/social links at the bottom of the site.
Add footer/bottom-of-site social media login options (social login entry points) for users.
Add/allowlist admin accounts for platform access: autozoo98@gmail.com and greenplantz2020@gmail.com.
Vendor/Nursery portal: add Sign Up form and Login flow for Vendor or Nursery Registration / Sign In (/portal/nursery).
Vendor/Nursery portal: add product adding page with product details including multiple product photos/images.
GreenPlantz Team/Admin portal: add Admin registration and sign-in pages (/portal/team).
GreenPlantz Team/Admin portal: after login, provide a view to list vendor/nursery shops and view the products each nursery has added.
GreenPlantz Team/Admin portal: allow GreenPlantz team members to remove/delete a nursery shop (vendor/nursery) from the platform.

Extend the backend Product data model and product management APIs to support product photos by storing an array of image URLs per product (e.g., imageUrls : [Text]) and returning it from getProduct, getActiveProducts, getProductsForCategory, searchProducts, and getProductsForGardenCenter.

Update the Team Portal (/portal/team) experience to include an explicit “Sign In” screen using Internet Identity, and ensure that authenticated platform admins are routed to the admin nursery management area; non-admin authenticated users must see an English access/permissions message explaining that platform admin access is required.

Add backend support for GreenPlantz team members (platform admins) to remove a nursery shop (garden center) from the platform, including defining an admin-only method to disable or delete a garden center and ensuring products associated with the removed nursery no longer appear in the public active product catalog.
Add GreenPlantz address/service area text "Kerala | Karnataka | Tamil Nadu | Andra Pradesh" to the website (likely in the footer/contact area).

Define and implement a structured product category taxonomy (Plants → Indoor/Outdoor, Seeds, Pots → Ceramic/Plastic/Fiber, Fertilizers) and ensure storefront supports category filtering and nursery product creation allows selecting a category/subcategory.

Update backend seed data initialization to create the full category taxonomy (including subcategories) and ensure seeded products (and/or newly created products) can be assigned to a leaf category (e.g., Indoor Plants, Ceramic Pots).
Add backend APIs for platform-admin allowlist management by Principal so an existing platform admin can grant admin access to the Principal corresponding to greenplantz2020@gmail.com.
Update branding assets: use provided large image as site logo and create a small 'GP' favicon for the GreenPlantz site.
Adjust the site header logo sizing so the new GreenPlantz logo is displayed at an appropriate/required size across screen sizes (responsive).

Create a resized, header-optimized version of the uploaded logo image "greenplantz final straight logo back ground removed cropped1 1080px-1.png" by scaling it to 112px tall (preserve aspect ratio, keep transparent background, no padding added unless required to avoid clipping) and save it as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated with a cache-busting filename.

Add the newly uploaded image (image-5.png) to frontend static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated/ and generate a header-optimized transparent PNG at exactly 112px height (preserve aspect ratio, no distortion, no extra padding unless needed to avoid clipping) using a cache-busting filename.

Add the newly uploaded logo image "greenplantz final straight logo back ground removed cropped1 1950px.png" to frontend static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated, generate a header-optimized transparent PNG at exactly 112px height (preserve aspect ratio, no distortion, no extra padding unless needed to avoid clipping) with a cache-busting filename, and ensure the generated file is present in the built frontend output.

Add an admin-controlled order assignment/authorization workflow: customer orders appear in GreenPlantz Team/Admin portal first; only after admin approval/assignment are order details shared with the assigned nursery/vendor.

Collect and store full customer profile details at registration/checkout: full name, delivery address (including state), PIN code, email, and mobile/phone number; show these details with each order in the GreenPlantz Team/Admin portal.

GreenPlantz Team/Admin portal: add an Orders management view showing assigned nursery/vendor, product details and quantities, and customer delivery/contact details; support admin approval/assignment of orders to a nursery/vendor.
Nursery/Vendor portal: once an order is assigned, allow the nursery/vendor to download a shipping slip for that order.

Add platform-admin allowlist entries for provided Internet Identity Principal IDs (including 7sopg-rkdvi-vg7tv-4foks-ejhyr-rotwu-wcdxm-kkij6-zwzel-qownx-aae and b6cav-3sd7q-navb4-zf3yt-52cnf-gzonh-zab4f-rnkfa-fg42t-64thx-7qe).

Add the Internet Identity Principal ID "7sopg-rkdvi-vg7tv-4foks-ejhyr-rotwu-wcdxm-kkij6-zwzel-qownx-aae" to the backend platform-admin allowlist so this principal is recognized as a Platform Admin (isPlatformAdmin = true) and can access the Team/Admin portal admin screens after signing in.

Ensure the backend recognizes these Internet Identity principals as Platform Admins by bootstrapping them into the admin allowlist during canister initialization and after upgrades (post-upgrade):
- b6cav-3sd7q-navb4-zf3yt-52cnf-gzonh-zab4f-rnkfa-fg42t-64thx-7qe
- 7sopg-rkdvi-vg7tv-4foks-ejhyr-rotwu-wcdxm-kkij6-zwzel-qownx-aae
Persist the platform-admin allowlist (AccessControl state) across canister upgrades so that admin access does not revert or get lost after redeployments/upgrades.

If implementing REQ-56 requires a state schema change (e.g., adding stable state for AccessControl), add a conditional Motoko migration (backend/migration.mo) that safely preserves existing app data and initializes any new stable fields without trapping.
